definition: to nibble away at sth/to eat into/to erode

sentences.english: Suffering with truth decay? Brush up on your Bible.
sentences.chinese: 心中的真理被蛀蝕了嗎？用你的聖經刷掉吧。

sentences.english: Sugar can decay the teeth of the children.
sentences.chinese: 糖會蛀蝕孩子們的牙齒。

sentences.english: Moths have eaten holes in my wool coat.
sentences.chinese: 蛾已經在我的羊毛衫上蛀蝕了一些小洞。

sentences.english: When not removed, plaque causes tooth decay and gum disease.
sentences.chinese: 牙斑如果不清除就會導致牙齒蛀蝕和牙齦疾病。

sentences.english: The dentist could detect no sign of decay in her teeth.
sentences.chinese: 牙醫在她的牙齒上找不到蛀蝕的跡象。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, termite-eaten wire poles ought to be replaced every two or three years.
sentences.chinese: 電杆被白蟻蛀蝕，一般兩三年就要換一次。

sentences.english: His teeth have begun to decay.
Cavities in teeth are caused by decay.
Sugar should be strictly restricted in a child's diet in that it can decay the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 在兒童飲食中要嚴格限制糖，因爲糖會蛀蝕牙齒。
